explanation: Dana claims she was in the university lab from 8 AM to 5 PM on Thursday and makes no mention of being there overnight. But Clue 3 reveals her keycard swiped out of the lab at 2:47 AM Thursday morning, placing her at the university in the dead of night. Clue 2 shows a flashlight at Sector 7 around 3 AM -- enough time for Dana to drive from campus to the dig site. She planted the pendant with store-bought soil (Clue 1) before dawn, then returned to the lab to establish her daytime alibi.
funFact: The most famous archaeological fraud was Piltdown Man in 1912, where a doctored skull fooled scientists for over 40 years before being exposed as a hoax.
